content.question: A planet of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> and radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> has uniform density throughout its volume. Which of the following expressions represents the gravitational field of the planet at a point a distance <math alttext="the fraction R over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>R</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> below the surface of the planet?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator G M, and denominator 4 R squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>G</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 3 G M, and denominator 4 R squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>G</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator G M, and denominator R squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>G</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 16 G M, and denominator 9 R squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn><mi>G</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 3 G M, and denominator 4 R squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>G</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>
